description: Scalar energy head baseline: E=g(h) instead of E=||fc4(h)||^2. No contrastive/CD term. Tests that scalar head doesn't break denoising training.
notes: Control experiment: scalar energy head (Linear(h,1)) replaces squared-norm (||fc4(h)||^2). No contrastive or CD loss applied. Proves scalar head doesn't break denoising via autograd gradient. energy_reg_weight=0 since scalar energies don't need magnitude bounding.
